extendedIngredients.name: beets
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds red beets, medium, scrubbed clean, green tops removed (see beet greens recipe for what to do with beet greens)
extendedIngredients.originalName: red beets, medium, scrubbed clean, green tops removed (see beet greens recipe for what to do with beet greens)

title: Roasted Beets With Balsamic Glaze
summary: Roasted Beets With Balsamic Glaze might be a good recipe to expand your side dish recipe box. One serving contains 131 calories, 0g of protein, and 14g of fat. This gluten free and vegan recipe serves 75 and costs 25 cents per serving. 1163 people were impressed by this recipe. Head to the store and pick up balsamic vinegar, sugar, salt, and a few other things to make it today. It is brought to you by Simply Recipes. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour and 15 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 25%, this dish is rather bad. Similar recipes include Roasted Beets with Balsamic Glaze, Roasted Red And Yellow Beets With Balsamic Glaze, and Roasted Beets with Balsamic and Olive Oil.
instructions: 1 Preheat oven to 400F. Line a roasting pan with aluminum foil. Place the beets in the pan. Rub olive oil over the beets, and sprinkle with salt. Cover the beets with another sheet of aluminum foil. Roast for 1 to 2 hours, depending on the size of the beets and how old they are. After 1 hour, test every fifteen minutes by poking a beet with the tines of a fork. Once the fork tines go in easily, the beets are tender and cooked. Remove from the oven.2 While the beets are cooling, prepare the balsamic glaze. In a small, shallow saut pan, add the balsamic vinegar and sugar. Heat on high until the vinegar has reduced to a syrup consistency. Remove from heat.3 After the beets have cooled for several minutes, but are still warm to the touch, peel off the outer skins and discard. Cut the beets into quarters or more, bite-sized pieces.4 Place beets in a serving bowl. Pour balsamic glaze over the beets. Stir in grated orange zest, and add salt and pepper to taste.Garnish with a little orange zest to serve.

steps.step: 1 Preheat oven to 400F. Line a roasting pan with aluminum foil.

Place the beets in the pan. Rub olive oil over the beets, and sprinkle with salt. Cover the beets with another sheet of aluminum foil. Roast for 1 to 2 hours, depending on the size of the beets and how old they are. After 1 hour, test every fifteen minutes by poking a beet with the tines of a fork. Once the fork tines go in easily, the beets are tender and cooked.
Remove from the oven.2 While the beets are cooling, prepare the balsamic glaze. In a small, shallow saut pan, add the balsamic vinegar and sugar.
Heat on high until the vinegar has reduced to a syrup consistency.
Remove from heat.3 After the beets have cooled for several minutes, but are still warm to the touch, peel off the outer skins and discard.
Cut the beets into quarters or more, bite-sized pieces.4
Place beets in a serving bowl.
Pour balsamic glaze over the beets. Stir in grated orange zest, and add salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with a little orange zest to serve.
